page.title: 06TRADE IN NENTHEAD
page.content: There are only two shops and two public houses in Nenthead. In 1871 Â£200 was raised to build the present store and adjoining house.It became the Cumbrian Co-op and was bought in May 1985 by Mrs.Sherlock who re-named it"Nenthead Stores".She employs one full-time and one part -time person.She is open 6 days a week 9-00 a.m_5-15 p.m.Her best customers are locals who buy mostly bread,milk and potatoes.A large sliced loaf costs 46p.Her biggest problem is getting deliveries on time at fair prices. Nenthead Post-Office premises were formerly a garage.Now they are a news agents also selling some groceries, sweets,wool and stationery.Mrs.Hall owns the premises and employs 1 lady. Cigarettes and newspapers sold mostly. A milkman delivers daily<22p @ pint> Butcher van and Fish van call weekly.
